valueAtRisk.description: VaR represents the maximum expected loss at a given confidence level over a specific time horizon

expectedShortfall.description: Expected Shortfall (CVaR) represents the expected loss given that the VaR threshold has been exceeded

volatility.description: Portfolio volatility measures the dispersion of returns, indicating overall portfolio risk

beta.description: Beta measures systematic risk relative to the market. Beta < 1 indicates lower volatility than the market

sharpeRatio.description: Sharpe Ratio measures risk-adjusted returns. Higher values indicate better risk-adjusted performance

maxDrawdown.description: Maximum Drawdown represents the largest peak-to-trough decline in portfolio value

liquidity.description: High liquidity score indicates strong ability to convert assets to cash without significant price impact

creditRisk.description: Low credit risk score indicates minimal exposure to counterparty default risk

modelComponents.description: The Cashera Risk Model V4.0 integrates multiple risk assessment methodologies

components.purpose: Quantify potential losses at 95% and 99% confidence levels

components.name: Expected Shortfall (CVaR)
components.purpose: Measure tail risk beyond VaR threshold

components.name: Volatility Analysis
components.purpose: Forecast future volatility and identify regime changes

components.name: Sharpe Ratio
components.method: Excess return divided by standard deviation
